New Records: Max Muncy ties Reggie Jackson for the longest postseason on-base streak with 12 consecutive plate appearances reaching safely.
The Dodgers tied the record for most walks in the first four games of a championship series with 30.
Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani hit a leadoff homer in the first inning.
Mookie Betts hit a two-run homer in the sixth inning.
Yoshinobu Yamamoto struck out eight batters in 4 1/3 innings.
Mets reliever Danny Young threw a 1-2-3 inning in the ninth frame.
Pre-Game Insights: Manager Carlos Mendoza announced that David Peterson will start Game 5 for the Mets.
Jack Flaherty will start Game 5 for the Dodgers after throwing seven scoreless innings in Game 1.
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Carlos Mendoza expressed concern over the Mets' starting pitching options for Game 5.
The Dodgers are heavily favored to close out the series in Game 5.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Shohei Ohtani fouled a ball off his left knee and was in noticeable pain but stayed in the game.
The Dodgers' bullpen has not allowed a run in a win this postseason.
The Dodgers sat Freddie Freeman to rest his ankle, yet scored seven runs in six innings.
